articles.title: Melissa McCarthy Kicks Off ‘SNL’ With Festive Monologue as She’s Toppled by a Snowstorm - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: The two-time Oscar nominee served as one of the final hosts of 'SNL' in 2025, with Josh O’Connor and Ariana Grande slated to lead the next finale two episodes of the year.

articles.title: Tucker Wetmore's Song 'Proving Me Right' is About Model Bryana Ferringer - TMZ
articles.description: Rising country star Tucker Wetmore sings that a lady in his life kept on doing him wrong in his new track ... and, we now know who he means -- his model ex!

articles.title: Trump awards medals to the Kennedy Center honorees including Sylvester Stallone, George Strait and more - CBS News
articles.description: President Trump presented medals to the 2025 Kennedy Center honorees during an Oval Office ceremony.

articles.title: White House Uses Sabrina Carpenter ‘SNL’ Clip for Another ICE Deportation Video - Rolling Stone
articles.description: The White House posted a pro-ICE video using an altered Sabrina Carpenter 'SNL' ad after she slammed them for using "Juno" in another similar clip.

articles.title: Texans’ Braxton Berrios, influencer Alix Earle break up after two years - New York Post
articles.description: One of the NFL’s celebrity couples is reportedly no more.

articles.title: Sabrina Carpenter Tells Industry Insiders ‘Write the Music You Want to Listen to Yourself’ as She Receives Variety’s Hitmaker of the Year Honor - Variety
articles.description: Sabrina Carpenter urged industry insiders to 'write the music you want to listen to yourself' as she accepted Variety's Hitmaker of the Year award.

articles.title: Richard Gere addresses his 20-year ban from the Oscars stage: 'I do what I do' - Entertainment Weekly
articles.description: Richard Gere made rare remarks about his 20-year ban from the Oscars stage after he advocated for Tibetan independence at the 1993 Academy Awards: 'I didn't take it particularly personally.'

articles.title: Sean Combs' Mother Rips Netflix Over Alleged "Fake Narratives" In 'Reckoning' Docuseries - Deadline

articles.title: Box Office: ‘Five Nights at Freddy’s 2’ Opening to Historic $57M, Scares Off Post-Thanksgiving Slump - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: The Blumhouse and Universal horror sequel is on course to boast the biggest opening ever for the weekend after the holiday, among other milestones.

articles.title: Jane Fonda Calls Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal 'Catastrophic' - Variety
articles.description: Jane Fonda called the Netflix-Warner Bros. deal a 'catastrophic' development that threatens to 'destroy our creative industry.'

articles.title: Sydney Sweeney addresses American Eagle ad, says she's 'against hate' - NBC News
articles.description: After months of silence followed by an uncomfortable interview with GQ magazine, actor Sydney Sweeney has finally addressed her controversial American Eagle advertisement head-on

articles.title: Julia Roberts and Sean Penn Bond Over Paul Thomas Anderson, Luca Guadagnino and ‘Cancel Culture’: ‘Shame Is Underrated These Days’ - Variety
articles.description: The "One Battle After Another" and "After the Hunt" stars join forces to talk "cancel culture" and their love for directors.

articles.title: 'The Abandons' is a sudsy soap opera dressed up in spurs and a cowboy hat - NPR
articles.description: On the surface it's a gorgeous, hardscrabble Western, awash in stark landscapes, grubby faces, bar fights and banditry. But scratch away the grime, and you expose the pure, glitzy soap opera beneath.

articles.title: Frank Gehry, who stretched architecture’s boundaries, dies at 96 - The Washington Post
articles.description: His unearthly but brilliant designs, from Los Angeles to Bilbao, became global landmarks.

articles.title: Quentin Tarantino trashes 'weak sauce' There Will Be Blood star: 'The weakest male actor in SAG' - Entertainment Weekly
